de.awi.floenavigation.deployment

Class AISStationCoordinateFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • de.awi.floenavigation.deployment.AISStationCoordinateFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class AISStationCoordinateFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    This Fragment runs on top of the DeploymentActivity and calculates the location parameters of a Fixed Station which is being deployed.

    The StationInstallFragment inserts the MMSI number in to the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. This fragment waits and checks the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable to see if a Position Report has been received from the given MMSI number. The Position Report PostnReportClassA and PostnReportClassB are received, decoded and inserted in to the Database by AISDecodingService. If a position report is received the fragment uses the location data (Latitude and Longitude) from the Position to calculate the angle Alpha and x and y coordinates of the Fixed Station and insert these values in DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable. If the position report is not received for a specified time the StationInstallFragment is called again to re-enter MMSI number. The Layout of this fragment shows a ProgressBar with a waiting message when waiting for the Position Report and once it receives the position report it shows a simple successful message with a button.

    See Also:
    AISDecodingService, DeploymentActivity, Runnable, AISMessageReceiver, PostnReportClassA, PostnReportClassB, SetupActivity, NavigationFunctions

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Fragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle). Reads the MMSI number of the Fixed Station passed to it by StationInstallFragment. The layout shows a ProgressBar with a waiting message and a cancel button.

        The fragment runs the aisStationRunnable to check the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable if the position data has been inserted by the AISDecodingService. If the data is inserted the Fragment calculates the distance, alpha, stationX and stationY of the Fixed Station and updates the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and changes the Layout to show a Finish button pressing which will start the AdminPageActivity. If the data is not yet inserted the aisStationRunnable increments autoCancelTimer and re-posts the aisStationRunnable with a delay of checkInterval. If the autoCancelTimer values goes above MAX_TIMER then the MMSI is removed from the DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable the aisStationRunnable is cancelled and control is returned to StationInstallFragment to re-enter a valid MMSI number.

        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called when the Fragment come back from background to foreground. Disables the Up Button and calls the actionBarUpdatesFunction() to set the correct icon colors in the Action Bar.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called when the Fragment is no longer in foreground. It unregisters the AIS and GPS BroadcastReceivers.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onClick

        public void onClick(android.view.View v)
        Default Handler for the Finish button on the Screen. It calls the onClickFinish() method.
        Specified by:

      • removeMMSIfromDBTable

        private void removeMMSIfromDBTable()
        Removes the MMSINumber from the Database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. Called when a position report is not received within the specified time interval or when the cancel button is pressed.

      • packetReceived

        private void packetReceived()
        Called when an AIS Packet (Position Report) is received from the Fixed Station. It changes the Layout of the fragment. It hides the ProgressBar and the waiting message and replaces it with a new successful insertion message changeText and changes the text of the Cancel button to Finish.

      • checkForAISPacket

        private boolean checkForAISPacket(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Checks the Database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable if the Position data of the Fixed Station has been inserted by the AISDecodingService. If the data is inserted it sets stationLatitude and stationLongitude to the received values.
        Returns:
        true if packet has been received.

      • onClickFinish

        private void onClickFinish()
        Handler for the Finish/Cancel Button. If the Fixed Station Deployment is complete meaning its position is received, parameters are calculated and inserted in to the database then the Fragment is finished and AdminPageActivity is started. If the Deployment is not yet complete that means the current deployment needs to be canceled, the MMSINumber is removed from the Database tables and handler callbacks are removed and StationInstallFragment is started to start a new deployment.

      • readParamsFromDatabase

        private boolean readParamsFromDatabase(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Reads the basic parameters of the Floe's Coordinate system from the Database. Reads the values of originMMSI, originLatitude, originLongitude, beta from their respective tables.
        Parameters:
        db - An instance SQLiteDatabase
        Returns:
        true if all the values are read successfully.

      • actionBarUpdatesFunction

        private void actionBarUpdatesFunction()
        Registers and implements the BroadcastReceivers for the AIS Connectivity and GPS location broadcasts; which are sent from NetworkMonitor and GPS_Service respectively. The GPS Broadcast receiver sets the value of locationStatus to the value from the GPS_Service. The AIS Connectivity broadcast receiver sets the boolean packetStatus. This also registers Runnable with the Handler statusHandler which runs at a regular interval specified by ActionBarActivity.UPDATE_TIME and it checks the booleans locationStatus and packetStatus and changes the Action Bar icons for GPS and AIS Connectivity accordingly.
        See Also:
        Runnable, Handler, BroadcastReceiver, ActionBarActivity
